Circuit court judges|website=www.wicourts.gov|access-date=2018-11-08}} |Milwaukee County Circuit Court |Wisconsin |''active'' |} ==References== {{reflist}} ==Sources== * Asian American Bar Association of The Greater Bay Area **[https://web.archive.org/web/20060909033629/http://aaba-bay.com/aaba/showpage.asp?code=apajudges APAs In The Judiciary Resource Page] **[https://web.archive.org/web/20060225204502/http://www.aaba-bay.com/aaba/showpage.asp?code=apafederaljudges Asian Americans and Pacific Islanders on the Federal Bench] **[http://www.aaba-bay.com/aaba/showpage.asp?code=current%20federal%20judges Current Asian Pacific American Federal Judges] **[http://www.aaba-bay.com/aaba/showpage.asp?code=Current%20California%20Judges Selected APA Judges in California] * [https://web.archive.org/web/20060824205313/http://www.asianweek.com/2002_08_23/bay_judges.html First Vietnamese American and Korean American Women Seated on State Judiciary], by [[Sam Chu Lin]], ''[[AsianWeek]]'', Aug. 23, 2002 * [http://www.tiengmag.com/article12.html Vietnamese American Facts], ''Tieng Magazine'' * [https://web.archive.org/web/20070926232739/http://news.asianweek.com/news/view_article.html?article_id=696cd8e360c2584cb63300c1fbb61c50 Two New APA Judges in Cook County, Illinois], ''[[AsianWeek]]'', Mar. 30, 2007 {{DEFAULTSORT:List Of Asian American Jurists}} [[Category:Asian-American issues]] [[Category:Lists of American people of Asian descent|Jurists]] [[Category:American jurists of Asian descent|*]]

revision.comment: /* 2009 */ Remove time element from ref date
revision.text:
{{redirect|Shoeing|the fitting of horseshoes|Horseshoe}} {{About||the throwing of shoes for entertainment|Shoe tossing}}
{{Expand list|date=December 2016}} {{Use dmy dates|date=November 2012}} [[File:bushduck.PNG|thumb|right|American President [[George W. Bush]] ducking a thrown shoe, while Prime Minister of Iraq [[Nouri al-Maliki]] attempts to catch it.<ref name=BBC081214/>]] Shoe-throwing, or '''shoeing''', showing the sole of one's shoe or using shoes to [[insult]] are forms of protest in many parts of the world. Shoe-throwing as an insult dates back to ancient times, even mentioned at [[Psalm 108]]:9 in the [[Old Testament]]. Modern incidents where shoes were thrown at political figures have taken place in [[Australia]], [[India]], [[Ireland]], [[Taiwan]], [[Hong Kong]], [[Pakistan]], the [[United Kingdom]], the [[United States]], and most notably the [[Arab world]].<ref name=Tel>[https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/worldnews/middleeast/iraq/3776970/Arab-culture-the-insult-of-the-shoe.html Arab culture: the insult of the shoe], ''[[The Daily Telegraph|The Telegraph]]'', 15 December 2008.</ref><ref name=BBC>[http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/middle_east/7783325.stm Bush shoe-ing worst Arab insult], BBC, 16 December 2008.</ref>
Posters of [[George W. Bush|George W. Bush's]] face have long appeared through the Middle East with shoes attached to them, and some people have called former [[Secretary of State]] [[Condoleezza Rice]] ''kundara'', meaning "shoe".<ref name=BBC/> Shoeing received attention after [[Muntadhar al-Zaidi]] threw his shoes at then U.S. President George W. Bush in a 14 December 2008 press conference in [[Baghdad, Iraq]]. Since the al-Zaidi incident, [[Copycat crimes|copycat]] incidents in Europe, North America, India, China, Hong Kong, [[Iran]], [[Turkey]]<ref>[https://news.yahoo.com/s/ap/20091001/ap_on_re_eu/world_economy_protest] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20091005102939/http://news.yahoo.com/s/ap/20091001/ap_on_re_eu/world_economy_protest|date=5 October 2009}}</ref> and Australia have been reported.
==Context== {{further|Taharah|Islamic hygienical jurisprudence}} Shoes are considered unclean in the [[Arab World]]. Matthew Cassel of ''[[The Electronic Intifada]]'' in the context of the "Bush shoeing" incident has expressed the opinion that the Western media overplayed the phenomenon as being "Arab" in particular.<ref name=AAN>[http://www.arabamericannews.com/news/index.php?mod=article&cat=World&article=1801 The shoe heard round the world], Matthew Cassel, Arab-American News.com, 20 December 2008. Retrieved 21 December 2008.</ref>
==Notable incidents== ===359=== *[[Constantius II]], Roman Emperor, was giving a speech from a small hill to a group of [[Limigantes]] to ask for their loyalty, when he was hit by a shoe thrown by one of them. The thrower shouted 'Marha, marha!' in a "signal of war." <ref>Ammianus Marcellinus Res Gestae XIX-XI-10</ref><ref>The Fall of the Roman Empire: A New History (p. 160) Peter Heather</ref>
===2008=== * '''7 April:''' [[Arbab Ghulam Rahim]], the former Chief Minister of [[Sindh, Pakistan]], was leaving the back door of the Sindh assembly building after taking oath as a newly elected member when he was hit by a shoe thrown by [[Agha Javed Pathan]], a worker from the [[Pakistan Peoples Party]].<ref name="paktribune">{{Cite news|title=Arbab Ghulam Rahim manhandled|url=http://www.paktribune.com/news/index.shtml?199225|work=Pakistan|publisher=Paktribune|date=8 April 2008|accessdate=4 March 2011|location=Karachi}}</ref>
[[File:Bush Shoe Throw.jpg|thumb|A replica of the shoe thrown at President Bush during a press conference in Iraq in 2008. Photograph taken at the Museum in TriBeCa, New York City.]] *'''14 December:''' During a press conference at the Prime Minister's Palace in [[Baghdad]], Iraq, journalist [[Muntadhar al-Zaidi]] threw his shoes at then United States President [[George W. Bush]]. "This is a farewell kiss from the [[Iraqi people]], you dog!" yelled al-Zaidi in Arabic as he threw his first shoe towards the U.S. president.<ref name=BBC081214>{{cite news|title = Shoes thrown at Bush on Iraq trip|work = Middle East|publisher = BBC News|date = 14 December 2008|url = http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/7782422.stm|accessdate = 15 December 2008}}</ref> "This is for the widows and orphans and [[Casualties of the Iraq War|all those killed in Iraq]]!" he shouted as he threw his second shoe.<ref name=BBC081214/> President Bush ducked twice, avoiding being hit by the shoes. {{Main|Bush shoeing incident}}
* '''17 December:''' [[Queens, New York|Queens]] resident and Amtrak employee Stephen Millies, a protestor at a meeting of the [[Metropolitan Transportation Authority]] (MTA), tried to throw his shoe at the CEO of the MTA with the statement, "This shoe is for you!" Millies managed to shake off his left shoe before being stopped and detained by MTA Police.<ref>{{cite news|title = This Shoe's for you, MTA! Protestor at board meeting inspired by Iraqi who threw shoes at Bush|last = Donohue|first = Pete|publisher = New York Daily News|work = NY Local|date = 17 December 2008|url = http://www.nydailynews.com/ny_local/2008/12/17/2008-12-17_this_shoes_for_you_mta_protestor_at_boar-1.html|accessdate = 22 December 2008}}</ref> * '''17 December:''' The [[Opposition to the Iraq War|anti-war]] group [[Code Pink]] pelted shoes at an effigy of then-U.S. President George W. Bush outside the [[White House]].<ref name = codepink>{{cite news|last = Fitzgerald|first = Tom|title = White House Protestors Throw Shoes at Bush Effigy|publisher = [[WTTG]]|date = 17 December 2008|url = http://www.myfoxdc.com/myfox/pages/News/Detail?contentId=8093611&version=2&locale=EN-US&layoutCode=TSTY&pageId=3.2.1|accessdate = 18 December 2008}}</ref> Protesters presented their shoes at U.S. embassies around the world to show their support for al-Zaidi.<ref>{{cite news|title=Antiwar protesters will be hurling shoes |publisher=[[The Chronicle Herald]] |date=19 December 2008 |url=http://thechronicleherald.ca/Canada/1096806.html |accessdate=23 December 2008 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20081227231641/http://thechronicleherald.ca/Canada/1096806.html |archivedate=27 December 2008 }}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title = Zakaria: Shoe-throwing incident shows good, bad of Iraq war|publisher = CNN|date = 19 December 2008|url = http://www.cnn.com/2008/WORLD/meast/12/19/zakaria.iraqshoes/index.html|accessdate = 23 December 2008}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Protesters wave shoes at US Embassy in Ankara |publisher=The Jerusalem Post |date=20 December 2008 |url=http://fr.jpost.com/servlet/Satellite?cid=1228728266202&pagename=JPost/JPArticle/ShowFull |accessdate=20 December 2008 }}{{dead link|date=May 2017 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title = Bush effigy pelted with shoes|publisher = Reuters|date = 24 December 2008|url = https://www.reuters.com/news/video?videoId=95941&feedType=VideoRSS&feedName=TopNews&videoChannel=1|accessdate = 24 December 2008}}</ref>
[[File:Protesters Throwing Shoes at Bush posters in Montreal.jpg|thumb|In Canada, protesters threw shoes at a poster of George Bush in front of the U.S. consulate in Montreal during a protest against the wars in Iraq and Afghanistan.]] * '''20 December:''' Protesters in [[Montreal]] and [[Toronto]] threw shoes at posters of then-U.S. President [[George W. Bush]] in front of their respective U.S. consulates to support [[Muntadhar al-Zaidi]], to demand his immediate release, and to celebrate his gesture. The shoe tosses took place in −24 °C weather during protests against the U.S. military occupations of Iraq and Afghanistan and against Canada's involvement in the U.S.-led war in Afghanistan. At the shoe toss event in Toronto, Ahmed Habib, a refugee from [[Baghdad]], said, "We don't think of Muntadhar al-Zaidi as a criminal but, in fact, we think of him as a hero. The only war criminal is George Bush and his buddy Stephen Harper, so shame on the both of them."<ref>[http://www.ctv.ca/servlet/ArticleNews/story/CTVNews/20081220/shoetossing_rallies_081220/20081220?hub=Canada Anti-war protesters target U.S. consulate]. Ctv.ca (20 December 2008). Retrieved 30 May 2011.</ref> At the shoe toss event in Montreal, [[Québec solidaire]] leader and [[National Assembly of Quebec|MNA]] [[Amir Khadir]] threw his shoes at a picture of President Bush and was later criticized and accused of betraying the "dignity and responsibilities of a[n] MNA."<ref>{{cite web|last=Shimo |first=Alex |url=http://www2.macleans.ca/tag/amir-khadir/ |title=My Manolos have something to say |publisher=Macleans |date=25 February 2009 |accessdate=30 December 2011}}</ref> * '''20 December:''' [[Ukraine|Ukrainian]] reporter Ihor Dmitriv pelted a Ukrainian politician with a shoe when Dmitriv became angered by the politician's sexist remarks. Speaking about Ukraine's possible accession to [[NATO]], Oleh Soskin said NATO membership was more favored by the Ukrainian women, as they were "the more intelligent" part of the body politic. Dmitriv said his attack was motivated by the Ukrainian leadership's "craziness" and said "a shoe is going to become a leading means (for common people) to influence their leaders."<ref name=Shoeing1>{{cite news|title=Another shoe-throwing journalist surfaces |publisher=PressTV |date=20 December 2008 |url=http://www.presstv.ir/detail.aspx?id=79054&sectionid=351020606 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20081221235759/http://www.presstv.ir/detail.aspx?id=79054&sectionid=351020606 |dead-url=yes |archive-date=21 December 2008 |accessdate=20 December 2008 }}</ref>
===2009===
* '''20 January:''' Protesters in the United States shoed an inflatable replica of [[George W. Bush]] in replication of al-Zaidi's shoe-throwing incident.<ref>{{cite news|title= Shoe-Bombers Strike Washington|publisher=Wired|date=20 January 2009|url=http://blog.wired.com/defense/2009/01/shoe-bombers-co.html|accessdate=21 January 2009}}</ref> * '''2 February:''' [[Chinese Premier]] [[Wen Jiabao]] was in [[London]], speaking with [[British Prime Minister]] [[Gordon Brown]] about economic cooperation and trade relations between China and the United Kingdom.<ref name=Times>{{Cite news |author=Ben Macintyre |author2=Nico Hines |title=Protester throws shoe at Chinese Premier Wen Jiabao |url=http://www.timesonline.co.uk/tol/news/uk/article5643558.ece |work=UK News |publisher=[[Times Online]] |location=United Kingdom |date=2 February 2009 |accessdate=3 June 2009}}</ref> That day, Wen was scheduled to give the [[Rede Lecture]] at the [[University of Cambridge]] entitled, "See China in the Light of Her Development". As Wen came to the end of his lecture, a man, later identified as a 27-year-old German national Martin Jahnke,<ref>{{cite web|title = Officials name suspect in Wen shoe case|publisher = [[Agence France-Presse]]|url = https://www.google.com/hostednews/afp/article/ALeqM5j-ickSUjFxvvKPrmlLTN_OoRNKKQ|date = 8 February 2009|accessdate = 9 February 2009}}</ref> stood from the audience, blew a whistle and shouted, "How can the university prostitute itself with this dictator here? How can you listen to these lies he's telling?" Jahnke then threw his shoe at Wen, although the shoe landed a few [[Foot (length)|feet]] away.<ref name=Times/> Fellow members of the audience shouted at Jahnke, "Shame on you", as he was escorted out of the auditorium.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/uk_news/politics/7865868.stm|title=Shoe hurled as Chinese PM speaks |last=BBC News UK|date=2 February 2009}}</ref> Jahnke was promptly removed from the lecture by university [[proctor]]s and then arrested by police on suspicion of [[breach of the peace]] and attempted [[assault]].<ref>{{Cite news |title=Protester throws shoe at China's premier |url=http://edition.cnn.com/2009/WORLD/europe/02/02/china.uk.shoe.protest/ |work=Europe |publisher=[[CNN.com]] |date=<!-- 05:49 GMT --> 3 February 2009 |accessdate=3 June 2009}}</ref> After the shoe was thrown, Premier Wen commented, "this despicable behaviour cannot stand in the way of friendship between China and the UK."<ref name=Times/> University [[Vice-Chancellor]] [[Alison Richard]] commented, "I deeply regret that a single member of the audience this afternoon failed to show the respect for our speaker that is customary at Cambridge. This university is a place for considered argument and [[debate]], not for shoe-throwing." Premier Wen urged leniency for the German student. "Education is best for a young student, and I hope he will have the opportunity to continue his education. The return of a prodigal is worth more than gold", said the message from Wen, posted on the [[Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the People's Republic of China|Foreign Ministry]] website.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://uk.reuters.com/article/idUKTRE51810P20090209|title=China's Wen urges leniency for Cambridge shoe thrower |last=Reuters UK|date=9 February 2009}}</ref> A district judge later concluded there was insufficient evidence to prove that Jahnke's behavior had caused harassment, alarm or distress to the Chinese leader or anyone else in the lecture theater. Human rights campaigners cheered him as he left Cambridge Magistrates' Court.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-1190379/Cambridge-student-threw-shoe-Chinese-premier-Wen-Jiabao-cleared.html?ITO=1490|title=Cambridge student who threw shoe at Chinese premier Wen Jiabao is cleared |last=Daily Mail Reporter|date=2 June 2009|publisher=Mail online|accessdate=2 June 2009}}</ref> "I didn't want to hit the premier personally. I thought just placing the shoe on the stage would be universally understood. What it was meant to be was a symbolic protest. I didn't intend to hurt people."<ref>{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/uk_news/england/cambridgeshire/8079165.stm|title=Shoe thrower cleared of offence |last=BBC News UK|date=2 June 2009}}</ref> During his trial, Jahnke's lawyers alleged that his prosecution was being pushed forward under pressure from the Chinese government, and that there had been political interference in the trial, though this accusation was dismissed by the trial judge due to lack of evidence.<ref name=time1>Hoff, Henning: [http://www.time.com/time/world/article/0,8599,1902486,00.html Cambridge Shoe Thrower Is Cleared], Time Magazine</ref> * '''5 February:''' Israeli Ambassador to Sweden [[Benny Dagan]] was hit by a protester's shoe while speaking about the 2009 [[Gaza War (2008–09)|Gaza War]]. The shoe throwers reportedly chanted "Murderer!" and "[[wikt:intifada|Intifada]]!".<ref>[[Jerusalem Post]] [http://fr.jpost.com/servlet/Satellite?cid=1233304696980&pagename=JPost/JPArticle/ShowFull Ambassador to Sweden gets 'the shoe']{{Dead link|date=November 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}, 5 February 2009</ref> * '''6 March:''' During a trip to the city of [[Urmia]], someone threw a shoe at the motorcade of President [[Mahmoud Ahmadinejad]]. People had become angry after the president's convoy hit an elderly man but did not stop. A shoe had previously been thrown at Ahmadinejad at [[Amirkabir University of Technology|Amir Kabir University]] in 2006.<ref name="guardian20090306">{{Cite news |author=Robert Tait |title=Shoe reportedly thrown at Iranian president Ahmadinejad |url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2009/mar/06/shoe-protest-iran-ahmadinejad |work=Iran |publisher=The Guardian |date=<!--15.58 GMT, -->6 March 2009 |accessdate=3 June 2009|location=London}}</ref> * '''17 March:''' Canadian protesters in [[Calgary]] used shoes as props during their demonstrations, even going so far as to create a "shoe cannon".<ref>{{cite news|title=Protests greet Bush's first speech as ex-president|work=Reuters|publisher=Reuters|date=17 March 2009|url =https://www.reuters.com/article/topNews/idUSTRE52G6PP20090317|accessdate=17 March 2009}}</ref> * '''April:''' A schoolteacher hurled a slipper at [[Indian National Congress]] [[Lok Sabha]] candidate [[Naveen Jindal]].<ref>{{cite web |title=How to shoe a neta away? Just aim and shoot |url=http://ibnlive.in.com/videos/90532/how-to-shoe-a-neta-away-just-aim-and-shoot.html |work=[[CNN-IBN]] |location=India |accessdate=3 June 2009}}</ref> * '''April:''' Some shareholders in [[Fortis (finance)|Fortis]] bank threw their shoes at executives in opposition to the decision to sell part of the bank to [[BNP Paribas]].<ref>{{Cite news |title=Shareholders throw shoes at Fortis meeting |author=Katherine Griffiths|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/finance/newsbysector/banksandfinance/5238122/Shareholders-throw-shoes-at-Fortis-meeting.html|work=[[The Daily Telegraph]]|location=United Kingdom|date=<!-- 7:08PM BST --> 28 April 2009|accessdate=3 June 2009}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news |title=Shoes thrown at Fortis chairman |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/world/europe/8023459.stm |work=[[BBC News]] |location=United Kingdom |date=<!-- 16:16 GMT --> 28 April 2009 |accessdate=3 June 2009}}</ref> * '''April:''' BJP worker Pavas Agrawal hurled a slipper at BJP leader [[Lal Krishna Advani]].<ref>[http://www.ndtv.com/convergence/ndtv/story.aspx?id=NEWEN20090090945 Shoe hurled at Advani in MP]. NDTV. {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090419075905/http://www.ndtv.com/convergence/ndtv/story.aspx?id=NEWEN20090090945 |date=19 April 2009 }}</ref> Agrawal was arrested for interrogation. * '''7 April:''' India's Home Minister [[P. Chidambaram]] was shoed by [[Jarnail Singh (born 1973)|Jarnail Singh]], a [[Sikh]] journalist who works at the [[Hindi]] daily [[Dainik Jagaran]].<ref name="indiatimes1">[http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/videoshow/4369344.cms The Times of India]. Timesofindia.indiatimes.com. Retrieved 30 May 2011.</ref> Chidamabaram was asked a question by Jarnail Singh on the [[Central Bureau of Investigation]]'s (CBI) clean chit to Congress leader [[Jagdish Tytler]] on the [[1984 anti-Sikh riots]]. He said that CBI was not under the home ministry, and no ministry of the government had put any pressure on the CBI. He said that "It is for the court to accept or reject or ask for further investigation by CBI. Let us wait for the court decision". When Jarnail Singh persisted with his questions, Chidambaram told him "no arguments, you are using this forum". Following this the journalist lobbed his shoe saying 'I protest'. Thrown underhand with little force, the shoe narrowly missed hitting Chidambaram. The action caused a flutter in the hall.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.starofmysore.com/main.asp?type=news&item=20187 |title=Star Of Mysore Online |publisher=Starofmysore.com |accessdate=1 September 2010}}</ref>{{Verify source|date=June 2009}} Chidambaram responded to the situation in a composed manner and said that the journalist should be removed from the press conference hall gently. Chidambaram said to the reporters, "let not the action of one emotional person hijack the entire press conference. I have answered his questions to the best of my ability." After the incident, Singh said that he was sorry for the method of protest he adopted, but issue is right. He added that he felt upset that the government had not done justice in the anti-Sikh riots. Singh also appealed to journalists and others not to repeat his actions. Asked if he could have used some other manner to protest, "For the last 25 years this has been happening. So what other method is left (to protest)", Jarnail Singh said.<ref>[http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/Now-a-shoe-thrown-at-Chidambaram/articleshow/4369381.cms Scribe lobs shoe at Chidambaram] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090411030547/http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/Now-a-shoe-thrown-at-Chidambaram/articleshow/4369381.cms |date=11 April 2009 }}</ref> Jarnail Singh was let off without any charges on the insistence of Chidambaram. The whole incident set off a major media feeding frenzy with 24x7 TV coverage and snowballed into a major election issue which embarrassed Congress politically. The police said that no complaint was lodged with them, and Chidambaram said that the journalist should be forgiven.<ref>[http://www.newspostonline.com/world-news/shoe-thrower-let-off-without-charges-2009040747735 Shoe thrower let off without charges]{{Dead link|date=November 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}. Newspostonline.com. Retrieved 30 May 2011.</ref> A few Sikh bodies came out in Singh's support and even offered rewards. The shoe throwing incident also sparked off widespread protests by Sikhs against the CBI which had given a clean chit to Tytler.<ref>[http://www.hindu.com/thehindu/holnus/002200904071610.htm Sikh bodies to give Rs. 2-lakh reward to shoe-thrower]. Hindu.com (7 April 2009). Retrieved 30 May 2011.</ref> After the shoe throwing incident, [[Indian National Congress|Congress]] calculated politically that all the media controversy created could make it lose many seats especially in [[Punjab (India)|Punjab]]. Fearing further controversy, Congress dropped both Tytler and Sajjan Kumar as congress candidates from Lok Sabha 2009 elections.<ref>[http://www.hindu.com/thehindu/holnus/000200904091817.htm Congress drops Jagdish Tytler, Sajjan Kumar]. Hindu.com (9 April 2009). Retrieved 30 May 2011.</ref> * '''16 April:''' Indian Leader of Opposition and Prime Ministerial candidate of [[National Democratic Alliance (India)|National Democratic Alliance]] [[L K Advani]] was shoed by his own party member, Pawas Agarwal, a former district vice-president of [[Bharatiya Janata Party]] (BJP) Katni Town in [[Madhya Pradesh]].<ref>{{cite web|author=Milind Ghatwai |url=http://www.expressindia.com/latest-news/Another-shoe-this-time-aimed-at-Advani/447692/3/ |title=Another shoe, this time aimed at Advani |publisher=Express India |date=16 April 2009 |accessdate=1 September 2010 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120926103515/http://www.expressindia.com/latest-news/Another-shoe-this-time-aimed-at-Advani/447692/3/ |archivedate=26 September 2012 |df= }}</ref> * '''26 April:''' During an election rally, [[Prime Minister of India|Indian Prime Minister]] [[Manmohan Singh]] came under a shoe attack in [[Ahmedabad]]. A 28-year-old man made an attempt to throw a shoe at Singh while he was addressing the rally. The shoe landed a few meters away from Singh. Soon after the incident took place, the shoe thrower was taken away by police. Singh asked the police not to file any charges. The incident was condemned by the opposition [[Bharatiya Janata Party]] and was called an "unestablished way of protesting against democracy."<ref>[http://www.ndtv.com/news/india/shoe_thrown_at_prime_minister_in_modi_land.php Shoe thrown at Prime Minister in Modi Land]. NDTV. Retrieved 26 April 2009.</ref> * '''1 October:''' A student threw a shoe at the director of the [[International Monetary Fund]], [[Dominique Strauss-Kahn]], as he addressed a university in [[Istanbul]], Turkey.<ref>[https://www.nytimes.com/reuters/2009/10/01/world/international-uk-imf-protest.html Student Throws Shoe At IMF Chief In Istanbul Protest]. ''[[The New York Times]]''. 1 October 2009.</ref> The shoe did not hit Strauss-Khan but landed on the stage. The student, Selçuk Özbek, from the left-wing newspaper [[BirGün]], was taken away by security as he shouted "IMF get out!" A female protestor was also escorted from the hall<ref>[http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/news/world/rest-of-world/Protester-throws-shoe-at-IMF-director-in-Istanbul/articleshow/5077183.cms Protester throws shoe at IMF director in Istanbul]. ''[[The Times of India]]''. 1 October 2009.</ref> while others shouted, "Go away IMF, you're stealing money."<ref>[http://edition.cnn.com/2009/WORLD/europe/10/01/turkey.imf.shoe.thrower/ Shoe thrower targets IMF chief in Istanbul]. [[CNN]]. 1 October 2009.</ref> * '''8 October''' A single shoe was hurled at [[Clifford May]] as a protest by a student named Muhammad Hussain, who was also the class representative of his class at Karachi University I.R. Dept. Pakistan.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.dawn.com/news/496114|title=An unfortunate act by a student|last=|first=|date=October 2009|website=Dawn|access-date=}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.siasat.pk/forums/threads/shoe-hurled-at-american-scholar-clifford-may-in-karachi-uni.26324/|title=Shoe Hurled at American Scholar Clifford May in Karachi University : Shamful|last=|first=|date=October 2009|website=www.siasat.pk|access-date=}}</ref> * '''23 October:''' Supporters of Iranian president [[Mahmoud Ahmadinejad]] threw their shoes at opposition leader [[Mehdi Karroubi]] as he visited [[Tehran]] during the [[2009 Iranian election protests]]. A fight broke out between supporters of Ahmadinejad and Karroubi and one of the Ahmadinejad supporters threw a shoe at Karroubi, which hit him in the face and resulted in his turban falling off.<ref>[[Google News]] [https://www.google.com/hostednews/afp/article/ALeqM5jccoey4CuKeqObpRB9V_w_kT7V-g Clashes as Iran opposition leader visits exhibition], 23 October 2009</ref> * '''November:''' a shoe was hurled at Gordana Čomić, Vice-President of the [[National Assembly of Serbia]] by [[Serbian Radical Party]] MP Gordana Pop-Lazić.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/europe/8381490.stm|title=Serbian MP in parliament shoe-throwing incident |last=Lowen|first=Mark|date=26 November 2009|publisher=BBC News|accessdate=30 April 2010}}</ref> * '''4 November''' Former Australian Prime Minister [[John Howard]] was delivering a speech about leadership in the new century at [[Cambridge University]] when an Australian student called him a racist before taking off his boot and throwing it in his direction.<ref>{{cite news| url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/worldnews/australiaandthepacific/australia/6498119/Student-throws-shoe-at-former-Australian-PM-John-Howard.html | location=London | work=The Daily Telegraph | title=Student throws shoe at former Australian PM John Howard | date=2009-11-04}}</ref> * '''1 December:''' [[Muntadhar al-Zaidi]], who first shoed [[George W. Bush]], was shoed himself in [[Paris]] by an exiled Iraqi journalist,<ref>{{cite news| url=https://www.reuters.com/article/latestCrisis/idUSGEE5B02HE|work=Reuters|title=Fellow Iraqi turns tables on Bush shoe-thrower|first=Sophie|last=Hardach|date=1 December 2009}}</ref> who accused him of "working for dictatorship in Iraq".<ref name="BBC091201">{{cite news|url = http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/world/middle_east/8389764.stm|title = Iraq shoe thrower Zaidi faces Paris shoe-ing|publisher = BBC News|date = 1 December 2009|accessdate = 6 December 2009}}</ref> The incident occurred while al-Zaidi was speaking about his experiences during the Bush shoeing and its aftermath.<ref name=CoycatShoeing>{{cite news | title = Iraqi Shoe Thrower Gets Taste of Own Medicine | publisher = [[Fox News]] | date = 2009-12-02 | url = http://www.foxnews.com/story/0,2933,578428,00.html?test=latestnews | accessdate = 2009-12-02 }}</ref> Al-Zaidi later said, "He stole my technique."<ref>{{cite web|url=http://english.aljazeera.net/news/europe/2009/12/200912119545858789.html |title=Iraq shoe-thrower under shoe attack – Europe |publisher=Al Jazeera English |date=1 December 2009 |accessdate=1 September 2010}}</ref>
===2010=== * '''January:''' During a public meeting, a man threw a shoe at [[Sudan]]ese President [[Omar al-Bashir]] in the Friendship Hall in [[Khartoum]], which missed. The man was later detained by security forces, while the President's office denied the incident took place and said the man was arrested as he attempted to pass a letter to al-Bashir.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/world/africa/8479185.stm|title=Sudan shoe-thrower 'targets President Omar al-Bashir'|date=25 January 2010|publisher=BBC News}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.google.com/hostednews/afp/article/ALeqM5i1UzP7VVW5HE17Mx8jwvF0cqb-xA|title=Man hurls shoe at Sudan President Beshir|date=25 January 2010|publisher=[[Agence France-Presse|AFP]]}}</ref> Witnesses described the man, whose reasons for throwing the shoe were unclear, as calm as he was detained.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://af.reuters.com/article/topNews/idAFJOE60O0DV20100125?sp=true|title=Man throws shoe at Sudanese president: witnesses|date=25 January 2010|publisher=[[Reuters|Reuters South Africa]]}}</ref> * '''27 January:''' During a hearing on [[medical marijuana]], 52-year-old Pinchas Cohen hurled his sneaker at President of the [[Supreme Court of Israel|Supreme Court]] of [[Israel]] [[Dorit Beinisch]]. The shoe struck Beinisch between the eyes, breaking her glasses and knocking her off her chair. Cohen, disgruntled over a family court decision four years prior, was arrested for the act, and sentenced for three years in prison.<ref>http://www.israelnationalnews.com/News/News.aspx/138352</ref> Cohen later apologized to Beinisch.<ref>{{cite web|url =http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2010/01/27/dorit-beinisch-attacker-h_n_438345.html|title =Dorit Beinisch: Attacker Hits Israeli Chief Justice With Sneaker In Face, Breaks Glasses|first =Aron|last =Heller|date =27 January 2010|publisher =The Huffington Post}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|author=Ze'ev Segal |url=http://www.haaretz.com/hasen/spages/1145659.html |title=Incitement against High Court led to Beinisch shoe incident|publisher=Haaretz.com |date=28 January 2010 |accessdate=29 May 2010}}</ref> * '''February:''' A 26-year-old Kurd with Syrian citizenship tried to shoe Turkish Prime Minister [[Recep Tayyip Erdoğan]] in [[Sevilla]]. The shoes missed Erdogan. While throwing the shoes, the man called, "long live free Kurdistan".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://news.am/eng/news/15105.html |title=Armenia News |publisher=NEWS.am |date=31 May 2010 |accessdate=1 September 2010}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CSy4qBtQHVE |title=Başbakan Tayyip Erdoğan'a İspanyada Ayakkabı Fırlattılar |publisher=YouTube |date=22 February 2010 |accessdate=1 September 2010}}</ref> * '''6 March:''' [[Chief Secretary for Administration]] [[Henry Tang]], attended a youth summit in [[Chai Wan]], Hong Kong, organized by the [[Home Affairs Bureau]]. A 31-year-old man threw a shoe at Tang, and it landed on the stage meters away from him. The man was taken away by police. The man was unemployed after getting fired by a computer company, and the government policies were not helping him. He said he was not a "post-80s" teen, but supported the [[Opposition to the Guangzhou-Hong Kong Express Rail Link|highspeed rail protest connecting HK to Guangdong]].<ref name="stan1">The Standard HK. "[http://www.thestandard.com.hk/news_detail.asp?pp_cat=30&art_id=95434&sid=27323606&con_type=1 The Standard.com] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20100309170033/http://www.thestandard.com.hk/news_detail.asp?pp_cat=30&art_id=95434&sid=27323606&con_type=1 |date=9 March 2010 }}." ''Assault rap aimed at shoe thrower.'' Retrieved on 7 March 2010.</ref> Before the summit, about 30 people from several youth groups gathered outside the building to wave banners and said the forum was a fake consultation and that young people's opinions were neglected.<ref name="scmp1">South China Morning Post. "[http://www.scmp.com/portal/site/SCMP/menuitem.2af62ecb329d3d7733492d9253a0a0a0/?vgnextoid=d52eed4ed5437210VgnVCM100000360a0a0aRCRD&ss=Hong+Kong&s=News SCMP]." ''Shoes thrown at Tang at youth summit.'' Retrieved on 7 March 2010.</ref> When Tang left the building, protesters tried to block his passage and demanded to speak to him. One protester laid on the road in front of Tang's car and had to be forcibly removed by the police. A protester said that the topics discussed in the summit are not those that any young person would be interested in.<ref name="scmp1"/> * '''7 August:''' [[President of Pakistan]] [[Asif Ali Zardari]] was targeted by a 50-year-old man named Sardar Shamim Khan, who hurled a pair of shoes at him during Zardari's visit to [[Birmingham]], England. Khan was wrestled down by security guards after he threw two shoes and shouted 'killer' as Zardari spoke during a political rally at the [[International Convention Centre, Birmingham|International Convention Centre]]. The shoes did not hit Zardari, who did not respond to the attack. Khan was believed to be a Pakistani national from [[Derby]] who was sitting in the front row at the rally. He was dressed in a traditional [[Shalwar kameez]]. Following the incident, he was led away by police, questioned, and later released without charge.<ref>{{cite web|author=Christina Savvas |url=http://www.sundaymercury.net/news/midlands-news/2010/08/08/man-throws-shoe-at-pakistan-president-asif-zardari-in-birmingham-66331-27019314/ |title=Man throws shoe at Pakistan president Asif Zardari in Birmingham |publisher=Sunday Mercury |date=8 August 2010 |accessdate=1 September 2010}}</ref> Shamim Khan said that he threw his shoes at him because Pakistan was fighting with the worst flood in eighty years and its aftermath while President Zardari was enjoying a week-long trip in Europe instead of being with his people. Shamim Khan is being treated as a national hero in Pakistan due to ongoing hatred against President Zardari in Pakistan.<ref>{{cite news | title = Shameem Khan, Zardari Shoe Thrower is Hero or Zero? Discuss | publisher = The Pakistani Spectator | date = 2010-08-07 | url = http://www.pkhope.com/shameem-khan-zardari-shoe-thrower-is-hero-or-zero-discuss/ | accessdate = 2016-11-21}}</ref> * The NBC series ''[[Kings (American TV series)|Kings]]'' imitated the shoe throwing incident in the episode "[[Kings (American TV series)#Episode list|The New King (Part 2)]]", released 25 July 2009 in USA.{{Citation needed|date=April 2010}} * '''15 August:''' A police officer hurled his brown leather shoe at [[Jammu and Kashmir]] Chief Minister [[Omar Abdullah]].<ref name="Police man hurls shoe at Omar's dias">{{cite web|author=Shujaat Bukhari |url=http://www.thehindu.com/news/national/article572446.ece |title=News / National : Breach of security in Srinagar |publisher=The Hindu |date=15 August 2010 |accessdate=1 September 2010}}</ref> The chief minister was about to address a gathering organised on India's 64th [[Independence Day (India)|Independence Day]]. The officer, identified as assistant sub-inspector of police Abdul Ahad Jan, later waved a black flag, shouting pro-freedom slogans against the Indian rule in the disputed territory. Abdullah's security men escorted the officer from the function venue.<ref name="Shoe hurled at J&K CM Omar Abdullah at I-Day function">{{cite web|author=IANS, 15 August 2010, 11.42am IST |url=http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/Shoe-hurled-at-JK-CM-Omar-Abdullah-at-I-Day-function/articleshow/6314400.cms |title=Shoe hurled at J&K CM Omar Abdullah at I-Day function – India – The Times of India |publisher=The Times of India |date=15 August 2010 |accessdate=1 September 2010}}</ref> * '''4 September:''' Former UK Prime Minister [[Tony Blair]] had an egg and shoes thrown at him at a signing for his book, ''[[A Journey]]'', outside [[Eason & Son|Eason's]] in [[Dublin]].<ref>[https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/newstopics/politics/tony-blair/7981878/Shoes-and-eggs-thrown-at-Tony-Blair-as-he-attends-book-signing.html Four men arrested after shoes and eggs are thrown at Tony Blair at book signing]. ''Telegraph''.</ref><ref>[https://www.theguardian.com/politics/2010/sep/04/tony-blair-attacked-memoirs-signing Tony Blair pelted with eggs and shoes at book signing]. ''Guardian''.</ref> * '''5 September''' [[Anti-war]] protesters threw eggs, bottles and shoes at former British Prime Minister [[Tony Blair]] at another book signing event in [[Dublin]], [[Ireland]].<ref>{{cite news| url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-northern-ireland-11187320 | work=BBC News | title=Four arrested as eggs thrown at Tony Blair | date=2010-09-05}}</ref> * '''11 September:''' A shoe was thrown at Greek Prime Minister [[George Papandreou]] while he was inaugurating the [[Thessaloniki International Fair]]. Stergios Prapavesis, a 50-year old [[Radiology|radiologist]] and militant of the Patriotic Front (PAM), tossed the shoe, shouting, "You are not a patriot, you are a traitor", referring to the decision of the Greek government under Papandreou to accept [[International Monetary Fund|IMF]], [[European Central Bank|ECB]], and [[European Union|EU]] austerity measures. The shoe missed him by inches while Prapavesis, along with his 15-year-old daughter and farmer Stavros Vitalis, who was with the pair at the time, was apprehended.<ref>[http://tvxs.gr/news/%CE%B5%CE%BB%CE%BB%CE%AC%CE%B4%CE%B1/%CF%80%CE%B1%CF%80%CE%BF%CF%8D%CF%84%CF%83%CE%B9-%CE%BA%CE%B1%CF%84%CE%AC-%CF%84%CE%BF%CF%85-%CE%B3-%CF%80%CE%B1%CF%80%CE%B1%CE%BD%CE%B4%CF%81%CE%AD%CE%BF%CF%85 Παπούτσι κατά του Γ. Παπανδρέου]. ''Tvxs.gr''.</ref> Just moments after he left, an angry protester threw another shoe at him.<ref>{{cite news| url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-europe-11271058 | work=BBC News | title=Greek unions protest against PM's austerity plans | date=2010-09-11}}</ref><ref>{{cite news| url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-europe-11295330 | work=BBC News | title=Protester throws shoe at Greek PM | date=2010-09-14}}</ref> On its website, the group "calls upon the Greek people to express their displeasure by throwing their old shoes along the Prime Minister's journey from the airport to the Thessaloniki International Fair." Prapavesis described the shoe-throwing incident as "a political act against the government's austerity policies" and warned that "many more will follow."<ref>[http://edition.cnn.com/2010/WORLD/europe/09/11/greece.shoe.throwing/#fbid=NcZhdR-4ETQ&wom=false Man arrested for throwing shoe at Greece's prime minister] ''CNN''</ref> * '''25 October:''' Two shoes were thrown at [[John Howard]], the former [[Prime Minister of Australia]], by [[Pete Gray (activist)|Peter Gray]], live on the [[ABC Television]] program ''[[Q&A (Australian talk show)|Q&A]]'' while Howard was defending his decision to commit Australian troops to the [[2003 invasion of Iraq]]. * '''November:''' During a [[Paramore]] concert at [[The O2 (Dublin)|The O2]] in [[Dublin]], Ireland, someone threw a shoe at Paramore's lead singer [[Hayley Williams]].<ref>{{cite av media|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jKzuvjrcfPk|title=Shoe is thrown at Hayley while singing ''CrushCrushCrush'' By Paramore Live.|date=16 November 2010|work=YouTube|accessdate=27 March 2015}}</ref>
===2011=== [[File:Demonstration in Imaba, Cario.jpg|thumb|A demonstration in Cairo. The sign has an [[open source]] [[:File:Hosni Mubarak getting the boot.png|caricature]] by [[Carlos Latuff]], which features shoeing.]] * '''6 February:''' A man threw a shoe at [[Pervez Musharraf]], the former [[President of Pakistan]], while Musharraf was addressing a Pakistani origin gathering at [[Walthamstow]], [[London]].<ref>[http://www.rediff.com/news/report/man-hurls-shoe-at-musharraf-in-london/20110207.htm Man hurls shoe at Musharraf in London]. Rediff.com (7 February 2011). Retrieved 30 May 2011.</ref> The man threw the shoe to protest against the U.S. detention of Pakistani citizens.<ref>[http://economictimes.indiatimes.com/news/politics/nation/man-throws-shoe-at-pervez-musharraf/articleshow/7441914.cms Man throws shoe at Pervez Musharraf]. Economictimes.indiatimes.com (7 February 2011). Retrieved 30 May 2011.</ref> * '''10 February:''' During the [[2011 Egyptian revolution]], [[Hosni Mubarak]] announced that he would not be stepping down from his position as [[President of Egypt]].<ref>[http://english.aljazeera.net/news/middleeast/2011/02/2011210172519776830.html Defiant Mubarak refuses to resign – Middle East]. Al Jazeera English (11 February 2011). Retrieved 30 May 2011.</ref> Crowds gathered in [[Cairo]]'s [[Tahrir Square]] and waved their shoes in protest.<ref>[http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-4027015,00.html Protesters wave shoes in dismay at Mubarak speech – Israel News, Ynetnews]. Ynetnews.com (20 June 1995). Retrieved 30 May 2011.</ref> * '''26 April:''' While arrested former chairman of the [[2010 Commonwealth Games]] Organising Committee [[Suresh Kalmadi]] was being led into court, Kapil Thakur from [[Madhya Pradesh]] threw a slipper at him, which missed Kalmadi.<ref>{{cite news|title=CWG scam: Suresh Kalmadi arrives in court to shoe welcome |url=http://www.indianexpress.com/news/cwg-scam-suresh-kalmadi-arrives-in-court-to-shoe-welcome/781669/0 |accessdate=26 April 2011 |newspaper=[[The Indian Express]] |date=26 April 2011 |agency=Express News Service |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/5yEK4Cenw?url=http://www.indianexpress.com/news/cwg-scam-suresh-kalmadi-arrives-in-court-to-shoe-welcome/781669/0 |archivedate=26 April 2011 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref> * '''19 May:''' [[Fang Binxing]], the Principal of [[Beijing University of Posts and Telecommunications]] (also known as "Father of [[Great Firewall of China|China's Great Fire Wall]]"<ref name=WSJ>{{cite news|url=https://blogs.wsj.com/chinarealtime/2010/12/20/father-of-chinas-great-firewall-shouted-off-own-microblog/|title='Father' of China's Great Firewall Shouted Off Own Microblog – China Real Time Report – WSJ|date=20 December 2010|publisher=[[Wall Street Journal]]|accessdate=25 December 2010}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|publisher=Yunnan Information Times|script-title=zh:"防火墙之父"北邮校长方滨兴微博遭网民"围攻"|url= http://china.nfdaily.cn/content/2010-12/23/content_18691581.htm|date=23 December 2010|accessdate=20 May 2011|language=Chinese}}</ref>) was hit on the chest by a shoe thrown at him by a [[Huazhong University of Science and Technology]] student who calls herself "hanunyi" (Chinese:寒君依, or 小湖北) while Fang was giving a lecture at [[Wuhan University]]. According to [[Radio France Internationale|RFI]], the student discussed the planned shoe attack on [[Twitter]] and, with the help of other bloggers, was able to locate the exact whereabouts and the time of Fang's lecture. After the shoeing, "Hanunyi" walked out while other students tried to obstruct school teachers who were going to detain her. "Hanunyi" became an instant internet hero of the Chinese blogosphere.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-asia-pacific-13455819 |title=China's Great Firewall designer 'hit by shoe |publisher=BBC |date=19 May 2011|accessdate=19 May 2011}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.chinese.rfi.fr/%E4%B8%AD%E5%9B%BD/20110519-gfw%E4%B9%8B%E7%88%B6%E6%AD%A6%E6%B1%89%E5%A4%A7%E5%AD%A6%E6%BC%94%E8%AE%B2%E9%81%AD%E9%81%87%E5%AD%A6%E7%94%9F%E6%89%94%E9%9E%8B%E6%8A%97%E8%AE%AE |title=GFW之父武汉大学演讲遭遇学生扔鞋抗议 |publisher=RTI |language=Chinese |date=19 May 2011|accessdate=19 May 2011}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://hosted2.ap.org/APDEFAULT/495d344a0d10421e9baa8ee77029cfbd/Article_2011-05-19-AS-China-Great-Firewall/id-8d49097381ed4d75a49869d917315339 |title=Designer of Chinese web controls hit by shoe |date=19 May 2011 |accessdate=19 May 2011 |publisher=Associated Press |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110524000331/http://hosted2.ap.org/APDEFAULT/495d344a0d10421e9baa8ee77029cfbd/Article_2011-05-19-AS-China-Great-Firewall/id-8d49097381ed4d75a49869d917315339 |archivedate=24 May 2011 }}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2011/05/20/world/asia/20china.html |title=Chinese Student Takes Aim, Literally, at Internet Regulator |date=19 May 2011 |accessdate=20 May 2011 |publisher=NY Times }}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://china.nfdaily.cn/content/2011-05/20/content_24355339.htm |script-title=zh:微博热点：方滨兴武汉大学遇"扔鞋"抗议？ |work=Yunnan Information Times | date=19 May 2011 |accessdate=20 May 2011 | language=Chinese}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.google.com/hostednews/afp/article/ALeqM5j8tohFUmhv3P-HvuaY64AFNcz2DA?docId=CNG.d3d11f5391ecef13ea0a591708a328de.651|title=Shoe attack on China web censor sparks online buzz(AFP) |date=19 May 2011 |accessdate=11 January 2012 |publisher=AFP }}</ref> During an interview with [[CNN]], "Hanunyi" said, "I'm not happy about what (Fang) does. His work made me spend unnecessary money to get access to the website that is supposed to be free... He makes my online surfing very inconvenient."<ref>{{cite news|url=http://edition.cnn.com/2011/WORLD/asiapcf/05/20/china.fire.wall.protest/index.html|title=Chinese student says he hurled shoe at Web regulator, sparks Web buzz|date=20 May 2011|accessdate=11 January 2012|publisher=CNN}}</ref> * '''6 June:''' Congress spokesperson [[Janardhan Dwivedi]] was targeted at a press conference by a man who tried to throw a shoe at him. It was reaction after Delhi Police ordered dismantle act against Yoga Teacher Baba [[Ramdev]]'s Protest against Corruption.{{clarify|date=April 2014}} The attacker, Sunil Kumar, posed as a journalist working with Nav Sanchar Patrika of [[Rajasthan]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Man tried to throw slipper at Janardhan Dwivedi|url=http://www.ndtv.com/article/india/shoe-thrown-at-congress-spokesperson-dwivedi-110533|publisher=NDTV|date=7 January 2012 |accessdate=6 June 2011}}</ref> * '''18 October:''' [[Right to Information Act|RTI]] activist, member of [[India Against Corruption]], and leader of [[Aam Aadmi Party]] [[Arvind Kejriwal]] was targeted in [[Lucknow]], India, when Jitendra Pathak threw a shoe at him but missed. It was one week after another member of IAC and senior Supreme Court of India Lawyer [[Prashant Bhushan]] was assaulted in his chamber at the Supreme Court.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2011-10-18/india/30296132_1_arvind-kejriwal-team-anna-attacker |title=Shoe hurled at Arvind Kejriwal in Lucknow, attacker arrested|date= 18 October 2011|publisher= [[The Times of India]]}}</ref> * '''12 December:''' 45-year-old textile worker identified as S. Rashid hurled his shoes at Iranian president [[Mahmoud Ahmadinejad]] in protest for not having received unemployment benefits. Rashid missed, instead striking a banner behind the president. Rashid was jailed before for throwing eggs and tomatoes at former president [[Mohammad Khatami]].<ref>[[CNN News]] [http://edition.cnn.com/2011/12/12/world/meast/iran-shoes-ahmadinejad/index.html?hpt=hp_t2 Iranian president targeted by shoe thrower], 12 December 2011</ref>
===2012=== * '''7 January:''' Numerous German protesters, unhappy with President [[Christian Wulff]]'s behaviour in a private loan scandal, waved the soles of their shoes at his official residence, calling for him to resign.<ref>{{cite news|title=Protesters cry 'Wulff must go!'|url=http://www.dw-world.de/dw/article/0,,15651823,00.html|accessdate=8 January 2012|newspaper=[[Deutsche Welle]]|date=7 January 2012}}</ref> * '''23 January:''' A shoe was thrown at Congress General Secretary and [[Amethi]] MP [[Rahul Gandhi]] during an election rally in [[Dehradun]], India. One person was detained for throwing the shoe. "If some people think that throwing a shoe will deter me and force me to run away, then they are mistaken. Rahul Gandhi will not run away," Gandhi said.<ref>{{cite news |title=Shoe thrown at Rahul Gandhi during a rally in Dehradun|url=http://ibnlive.in.com/news/shoe-thrown-at-rahul-gandhi-in-dehradun/223553-37-170.html |work=IBNLive |first=Shreya |last=Dhoundial |date=23 January 2012 |accessdate=5 February 2012}}</ref> * '''11 May:''' In [[Oslo]], Norway, an Iraqi man threw a shoe at [[Anders Behring Breivik]] during [[Trial of Anders Behring Breivik|Breivik's trial for mass murder]]. The man shouted in English, "You killed my brother! Go to hell!" The man throwing the shoe was the brother of one of Breivik's victims on [[Utøya]]. The shoe did not hit Breivik, but hit instead [[Vibeke Hein Bæra]], one of Breivik's lawyers. Some onlookers cheered and applauded the shoe-throwing. The trial was temporarily suspended following the incident.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-europe-18034156|title=Breivik trial: Shoe thrown at Norway mass killer|date=11 May 2012|publisher=BBC|accessdate=12 May 2012}}</ref> * '''July 15:''' in [[Alexandria]], Egypt, during an official visit to Egypt, U.S. Secretary of State [[Hillary Clinton]]'s motorcade was pelted with shoes and tomatoes by protesters chanting "Monica, Monica", a reference to the [[Monica Lewinsky scandal]] involving her husband, former President [[Bill Clinton]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2012/07/15/hillary-clinton-egypt-motorcade-tomatoes_n_1674903.html|title=Protesters In Egypt Pelt Hillary Clinton's Motorcade With Tomatoes|work=The Huffington Post|accessdate=27 March 2015}}</ref> * '''10 December:''' in [[Xindian District|Xindian]], [[New Taipei]], Taiwan,<ref>Jingmei Human Rights Park, in which the activity was held, is in Xindian instead of [[Jingmei]], [[Wenshan District]], Taipei. {{cite web|url=https://maps.google.com.tw/maps?q=%E6%99%AF%E7%BE%8E%E4%BA%BA%E6%AC%8A%E6%96%87%E5%8C%96%E5%9C%92%E5%8D%80&hl=zh-TW&ie=UTF8&ll=24.988193,121.53214&spn=0.003807,0.006968&cid=16634992756568333252&gl=TW&t=h&z=18&brcurrent=3,0x346803de3309ff0b:0x28912d7c845b6a29,0,0x345d5538b0b6645f:0x5aa90dfa6620edc0|title=Google Maps Showing the location of the park|accessdate=2012-12-12|publisher=Google Inc.}}</ref> some protesters threw various items, including a shoe, toward President [[Ma Ying-jeou]] during an activity related to [[Human Rights Day]], but Ma was not hit by the shoe.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/zhongwen/trad/taiwan_letters/2012/12/121210_human_rights_ma.shtml |title=台總統馬英九人權日遭扔鞋抗議 |date=2012-12-10 |accessdate=2012-12-11 |publisher=BBC}} {{zh-tw}}</ref>
===2013=== * '''February:''' An Iraqi man threw shoes at the former US diplomat [[Paul Bremer]] who served as civil governor of Iraq following the 2003 [[Iraq War|US invasion]] of the country. The incident happened at a meeting in the [[British Parliament]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.digitaljournal.com/article/343247#ixzz2Kbgyp3eF|title=Video: Iraqi man hurls shoes at former US diplomat Paul Bremer|publisher=|accessdate=27 March 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://worldnews.nbcnews.com/_news/2013/02/09/16914436-protester-hurls-shoes-at-paul-bremer-former-us-envoy-to-iraq?lite|title=Protester hurls shoes at Paul Bremer, former US envoy to Iraq|author=World News|date=27 March 2015|work=NBC News|accessdate=27 March 2015}}</ref> * '''6-7 February:''' in [[Cairo]], Egypt, an Egyptian man threw a shoe at Iranian President [[Mahmoud Ahmadinejad]] but missed.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://edition.cnn.com/2013/02/06/world/meast/egypt-ahmadinejad-shoe-attack/#cnn-disqus-area|title=Shoes hurled at Iranian President Ahmadinejad during trip to Cairo|author=Adam Makary, for CNN|date=6 February 2013|work=CNN|accessdate=27 March 2015}}</ref> The next day at a reception hosted by the Iranian delegation to the Islamic Summit, another man threw a shoe at Ahmadinejad while he spoke to a small crowd. This shoe did hit him while he was speaking, but he continued his remarks.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.thecommentator.com/article/3785/north_korean_diplomats_dine_alone|title=North Korean diplomats dine alone - The Commentator|website=www.thecommentator.com|language=en|access-date=2018-04-29}}</ref> * '''26 February:''' A shoe was thrown at [[Harry Styles]] of [[One Direction]] during the [[Glasgow]] leg of their [[Take Me Home Tour (One Direction)|Take Me Home Tour]] on 26 February 2013. The shoe hit him in the groin, and the singer was seen bending over in pain before falling to the ground.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://news.sky.com/story/1057767/harry-styles-floored-after-shoe-thrown-by-fan|title=Harry Styles Floored After Shoe Thrown By Fan|work=Sky News|accessdate=27 March 2015}}</ref> * '''29 March:''' Tajammul Lodhi, a [[Karachi]] lawyer, threw his shoe at [[Pervez Musharraf]] while Musharraf was leaving Sindh High Court after obtaining an extension of his pre-arrest bail in a series of cases. Lodhi later said in an interview that he had thrown the shoe because he hated Musharraf for trying to destroy democracy in Pakistan. Musharraf was hit on the nose.<ref name="Zee News">{{Cite news|title=Tajammul Lodhi wanted to 'placate' mother by hurling shoe at Musharraf|url=http://zeenews.india.com/news/world/tajammul-lodhi-wanted-to-placate-mother-by-hurling-shoe-at-musharraf_838532.html|work=Pakistan|publisher=ZeeNews|date=29 March 2013|accessdate=30 March 2013|location=Karachi}}</ref> * '''24 April:''' Stephen Patel, the vice-principal at Holy Spirit [[Separate school|Catholic]] [[elementary school|Elementary School]], located in an eastern end of [[Toronto]] - [[Scarborough, Toronto|Scarborough]], [[Ontario]], [[Canada]] threw a shoe at a 14-year-old student Ian Goulbourne in the forehead while on the excursion at [[Montreal]] on the school bus.<ref>Yuen, Jenny [http://www.torontosun.com/2013/04/26/toronto-student-injured-by-shoe-throwing-tcdsb-vice-principal Toronto student injured by shoe-throwing TCDSB vice-principal] - ''[[Toronto Sun]]'', 26 April 2013. Retrieved on 11 April 2016.</ref> Goulborune was taken to the [[Montreal Children's Hospital]] to be treated and Patel was sent home the next day on the [[VIA Rail Canada|VIA Rail]] train on paid leave by the [[Toronto Catholic District School Board]] while it investigated such incident.<ref>Hauch, Valerie [https://www.thestar.com/yourtoronto/education/2013/04/27/viceprincipal_throws_shoe_at_student.html Vice-principal throws shoe at student] - ''[[Toronto Star]]'', 27 April 2013. Retrieved on 11 April 2016.</ref>
====Taiwan==== [[File:2013 臺灣人民捐鞋供公民團體抗議威鞋脅馬英九並要求違法亂政漠視民意的中國國民黨下臺 Taiwanese People Donate Shoes to Support Protest and Shoe-throwing against KMT Ma Ying-jeou.png|thumb|300px|Taiwanese people donate old shoes all around the country to support protest and shoe-throwing against the Ma Ying-jeou administration and the ruling party KMT<ref>[http://www.voacantonese.com/content/taiwan-protest-20131001/1760440.html 台灣公民街頭遊行“威鞋(脅)”馬英九], 美國之音, 2013-10-1</ref>]]
* '''8 September:''' In [[Taipei]], Taiwan, some protesters gathered in front of the [[Presidential Office Building, Taipei|Office of the President]] and threw shoes toward [[President of the Republic of China]] [[Ma Ying-jeou]], but he was not hit by these shoes.<ref>{{cite av media|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Jwb4_CqMtGE|title=908台灣國升旗大會，丟鞋行動。|date=8 September 2013|work=YouTube|accessdate=27 March 2015}}</ref> This was one of the first occurrences of which Ma had shoes thrown at him during public appearances. This became such a problem that various police departments in Taiwan spent NT$482,890 (US$16,000) to purchase 149 anti-shoeing nets.<ref>{{cite av media|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Ial6gVqBzO4&feature=player_detailpage#t=45|title=防「威鞋」 全國縣市警50萬買網－民視新聞|date=23 October 2013|work=YouTube|accessdate=27 March 2015}}</ref> * '''18 September:''' A shoe was thrown at [[Liu Cheng-hung]], then-Magistrate of [[Miaoli County]], Taiwan, when he attempted to offer his condolences to the family of a man found dead in a water channel under a bridge at [[Dapu incident|Dapu]], [[Zhunan, Miaoli|Zhunan]], Miaoli County. Supporters and relatives of the drowned man held Liu responsible for the man's death because the man's pharmacy was one of several structures destroyed by the Miaoli government earlier that July to make way for the construction of a new campus at the [[Hsinchu Science Park]]. The shoe, which was owned by protester Chen Wei-Ting, hit Liu in the head.<ref>http://www.chinapost.com.tw/taiwan/local/miaoli/2013/09/18/389277/Miaoli-magistrate.htm</ref><ref>{{cite av media|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5bd6LwE5tcc|title=突襲！遭鞋K頭 劉政鴻探張家掛彩|date=18 September 2013|work=YouTube|accessdate=27 March 2015}}</ref> * '''26 September:''' In [[Yunlin County]], Taiwan, some protesters threw shoes at President Ma Ying-jeou during a student forum at [[National Yunlin University of Science and Technology]], but he was not hit by these shoes.<ref>{{cite av media|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YDvs_kOGXdI|title=怒吼下台! 馬英九南下遭圍堵丟鞋|date=25 September 2013|work=YouTube|accessdate=27 March 2015}}</ref> * '''29 September:''' In [[Taipei City]], Taiwan, some protesters gathered in front of the Office of the President and threw shoes at President Ma Ying-jeou, but he was not hit by these shoes.<ref>{{cite av media|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9CMcOecs1Eg|title=中天新聞》丟鞋嗆馬 千名黑衫軍集結國父紀念館|date=29 September 2013|work=YouTube|accessdate=27 March 2015}}</ref> * '''10 October:''' In [[Taipei City]], [[Taiwan]], some protesters gathered in front of Office of the President and threw shoes, toward President Ma Ying-jeou during an activity related to [[National Day of the Republic of China|Taiwan National Day]], but he was not hit by these shoes.<ref>{{cite av media|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rMzGbKm2Eek|title=YouTube|publisher=|accessdate=27 March 2015}}</ref> * '''12 October:''' In [[Chiayi County]], Taiwan, some protesters threw shoes at President Ma Ying-jeou's convoy during the Mayoral Forum of [[Kuomintang]]. The police tried to avoid conflict between protesters and the convoy by implementing a one-story-high shoes-catching net. Several shoes thrown by protesters were caught by the special net; Ma Ying-jeou was not hit.<ref>{{cite av media|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cKcHw9fi-SA|title=【2013.10.12】馬參加首長會議 民眾丟鞋抗議 -udn tv|date=12 October 2013|work=YouTube|accessdate=27 March 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite av media|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mNFuiBeMRkg|title=[東森新聞]馬英九南下嘉義 遭民眾丟鞋嗆聲|date=12 October 2013|work=YouTube|accessdate=27 March 2015}}</ref> * '''19 October:''' In [[Keelung]], Taiwan, some protesters threw shoes at President Ma Ying-jeou during an activity related to anniversary of the founding of [[National Taiwan Ocean University]], but he was not hit by these shoes.<ref>{{cite av media|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=b-hCp__Ms50|title=議員嗆馬丟鞋踩校徽 觸怒海大生(民視新聞)|date=19 October 2013|work=YouTube|accessdate=27 March 2015}}</ref> * '''19 October:''' In Taipei City, Taiwan, a protester threw a shoe at President Ma Ying-jeou during the opening ceremony of the 2013 National Games, but he was not hit by the shoe.<ref>{{cite av media|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=NWonNIRFLcE|title=出席全運會開幕 馬英九致詞遭丟鞋 壹電視 2013 10 19|date=19 October 2013|work=YouTube|accessdate=27 March 2015}}</ref> * '''20 October:''' In Taipei City, Taiwan, some protesters threw shoes at President Ma Ying-jeou during the Taipei Hakka Yimin Festival, but he was not hit by these shoes.<ref>{{cite av media|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VjUB_MNVtxM|title=又見"讓鞋子飛"! 婦背嬰扔紅鞋險K馬|date=20 October 2013|work=YouTube|accessdate=27 March 2015}}</ref> * '''10 November:''' In [[Wuqi District]], [[Taichung]], Taiwan, protesters threw shoes at Ma Ying-Jeou's convoy when passing by while Ma attended the Kuomintang's (KMT) [[19th National Congress of Kuomintang|19th National Congress meeting]]. Ma was not hit by these shoes due to heavy police security implementations. Containers with urine and fireworks were also used in the protests.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://thenanfang.com/bamboo-gang-heavenly-way-alliance-four-seas-gang-world-taiwans-triads/|title=Bamboo Gang, Heavenly Way Alliance, and the Four Seas Gang: The World of Taiwan’s Triads|last=Teon|first=Aris|date=July 2015|website=thenanfang.com|access-date=}}</ref>
===2014=== * '''10 April:''' In [[Las Vegas]], [[Nevada]], United States, a female protestor threw a shoe at [[Hillary Clinton]] during a scrap metal recycling conference. Clinton was not hit by the shoe and subsequently joked about it.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.reviewjournal.com/politics/shoe-misses-hillary-she-speaks-recycling-conference-las-vegas|title=Shoe misses Hillary as she speaks at recycling conference in Las Vegas|author=LAURA MYERS LAS VEGAS REVIEW-JOURNAL|work=Las Vegas Review-Journal|accessdate=27 March 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite av media|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=16T6UJW5oWY|title=Raw:Shoe Thrown at Hillary Clinton During Speech|date=10 April 2014|work=YouTube|accessdate=27 March 2015}}</ref> * '''19 April:''' In [[Lahti]], Finland, the supporters of [[FC Lahti]] waved their shoes during a football match against [[HJK Helsinki]] in disrespect of the HJK team and supporters. Before the game, local police stopped a fight between 40 supporters from Lahti and Helsinki.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.iltalehti.fi/jalkapallo/2014041918227330_vg.shtml|title=FC Lahden ja HJK:n fanit tappelivat|publisher=|accessdate=27 March 2015}}</ref> * '''4 August:''' In [[Las Vegas]], [[Nevada]], United States, following an "Ultimate Media Day" at MGM Grand Hotel and Casino in Las Vegas for UFC 178, UFC light heavyweight champion (at the time) [[Jon Jones]] and upcoming challenger [[Daniel Cormier]] got into a scuffle on stage, after which Cormier threw a shoe at Jones.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://fightland.vice.com/blog/did-jon-jones-just-get-inside-cormiers-head|title=Did Jon Jones Just Get Inside Cormier's Head? |publisher=Fightland|accessdate=2014-08-06}}</ref>
* '''15 August:''' In [[Issru]], [[Ludhiana]], India, An unemployed youth Vikram Singh threw his shoe allegedly towards [[Chief Minister of Punjab (India)|Chief Minister of Punjab]] [[Parkash Singh Badal]] while he was on the dais during a political conference.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.firstpost.com/india/angry-youth-throws-shoe-towards-punjab-cm-parkash-badal-1666501.html|title=Angry youth throws shoe towards Punjab CM Parkash Badal|work=Firstpost|accessdate=27 March 2015}}</ref> * '''12 October:''' Ronnie Price threw his shoe at Andre Iguodala during a Warriors-Lakers game.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://deadspin.com/ronnie-price-loses-shoe-turns-over-ball-throws-shoe-1645560355|title=Ronnie Price Loses Shoe, Turns Over Ball, Throws Shoe, Gets Technical|author=Samer Kalaf|work=Deadspin|accessdate=27 March 2015}}</ref>
===2015=== * '''5 January:''' In [[Patna]], India, a man threw a shoe at the [[Chief Minister of Bihar]], [[Jitan Ram Manjhi]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ndtv.com/article/india/shoe-thrown-at-bihar-chief-minister-at-public-meeting-man-arrested-644160|title=Shoe Thrown at Bihar Chief Minister at Public Meeting, Man Detained|author1=Manish Kumar |author2=Alok Pandey |date=5 January 2015|work=NDTV.com|accessdate=27 March 2015}}</ref> * '''28 January:''' [[Atlético Madrid]] player [[Arda Turan]] threw his shoe at the [[Assistant referee (association football)|linesman]] in a [[2014–15 Copa del Rey|Copa del Rey]] game against [[FC Barcelona]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.sbnation.com/soccer/2015/1/28/7931793/arda-turan-threw-his-shoe-at-the-ref-and-didnt-get-sent-off|title=Arda Turan threw his shoe at the ref and didn't get sent off|author=Ryan Rosenblatt|publisher=Vox Media|work=SBNation.com|accessdate=27 March 2015}}</ref> * '''21 March:''' [[Marta Jandová]] threw off her shoe in the middle of her song performance, representing the [[Czech Republic]] at the [[Eurovision Song Contest]] 2015 in [[Vienna]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.eurovision.tv/page/news?id=live_second_semi-final_live_from_vienna|title=LIVE: Second Semi-Final live from Vienna!|accessdate=21 May 2015}}</ref> * '''14 June:''' David Sprigg threw his shoes at Australian Immigration Minister Peter Dutton in Brisbane, later saying, "I think he should be ashamed for what his government is doing and how asylum seekers are being treated in detention centres. When they use language like 'queue jumpers' and 'illegal arrivals', I think they're really just turning the public against refugees."<ref>http://www.9news.com.au/national/2015/06/14/15/24/qld-man-throws-shoes-at-peter-dutton#ChoZpYAu6CJP6ZD7.99</ref> * '''4 November:''' At a seminar in [[Chennai]] on "The Future of Sri Lankan Tamil Refugees in India", a 35-year-old Sri Lankan Tamil later identified as Prabhakaran of [[Aranthangi]] in [[Pudukkottai]], [[Tamil Nadu]], hurled a slipper at India's former [[National Security Advisor (India)|National Security Advisor]] [[M. K. Narayanan]] after Narayanan finished speaking. As police escorted Prabhakaran from the room, he stated that Narayanan was responsible for the massacre of thousands of [[Tamils]] in [[Sri Lanka]].<ref>{{cite news|url=http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/Man-hurls-footwear-at-former-national-security-adviser-M-K-Narayanan-in-Chennai/articleshow/49663203.cms|title=Man hurls footwear at former national security adviser M K Narayanan in Chennai|author=A Selvaraj|newspaper=[[The Times of India]]|date=4 November 2015|accessdate=6 November 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.cmust.com/aranthangi-prabhakaran-interview/|title=Aranthangi Prabhakaran Interview|publisher=cmust.com|author=Vaishnavi Vaishu|date=5 November 2015|accessdate=6 November 2015}}</ref>
===2016=== * '''1 March:''' A man hit the Pakistani Federal minister for Information and Broadcasting [[Pervaiz Rashid]] with a shoes, protesting the execution of Ghazi Mumtaz Hussain Qadri Shaheed.<ref>{{cite web|title=Federal minister Pervaiz Rashid becomes the member of Shoe Club|url=http://lahoreworld.com/2016/03/02/federal-minister-pervaiz-rashid-becomes-the-member-of-shoe-club/|website=Lahore World|accessdate=11 March 2018}}</ref> * '''31 March:''' In Ulan-Bator, Mongolia at the MEF (Mongolian Economic Forum) Prime minister [[Zandaakhüügiin Enkhbold|Enkhbold Zandaakhuu]], the speaker of [[Great Hural]] (Parliament), held the closing speech. Meanwhile, an economist named L.Naranbaatar threw a sock and yelled to the speaker. And security persons evacuated Naranbaatar out of the auditorium.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.sanfrancisco.consul.mn/eng/index.php?moduls=101&id=324|title=MONGOLIAN ECONOMIC FORUM 2016 CONCLUDED|last=|first=|date=April 2016|website=Consulate General of Mongolia in San Francisco|access-date=}}</ref>
===2017=== * '''11 January:''' [[Chief Minister of Punjab (India)|Chief Minister of Punjab]], [[Parkash Singh Badal]], was addressing the people present in Ratta Khera Village of his constituency, Lambi. Meanwhile, a relative of Sikh Preacher Amrik Singh Ajnala hurled the shoe at him to protest last year's burning of Sikh Holy Books and yelled at the speaker.<ref>{{cite web| url= http://www.newindianexpress.com/nation/2017/jan/11/shoe-hurdled-at-cm-badal-during-election-campaign-in-his-own-constituency-1558572.html|title= Shoe Hurdled at CM Badal during election campaign in his own constituency|last= Bajwa|first= Harpreet|date= 11 January 2017|website= www.newindianexpress.com|publisher= New Indian Express|access-date= 11 January 2017}}</ref> A similar incident happened to Badal in 2014 also. * '''10 June:''' At the Summerburst Festival 2017 in [[Stockholm]], [[Justin Bieber]] had a shoe thrown at him because he could not remember the lyrics to Spanish single, "Despacito".<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://etcanada.com/news/232874/justin-bieber-refuses-to-sing-despacito-fan-hurls-shoe-towards-singers-face/|title=Luis Fonsi Supports Justin Bieber’s Refusal To Sing ‘Despacito’ In Concert: ‘That’s Not His Main Language’|last=MAHJOURI|first=SHAKIEL|date=June 2017|website=ET Canada|access-date=}}</ref>
===2018=== *'''30 January:''' A group of [[San Diego|San Diegans]] hurled [[flip-flops]] at a screen displaying [[2018 State of the Union Address|Donald Trump's State of the Union address]].<ref>{{cite news|last1=Villalobos|first1=Rigo|last2=Stickney|first2=R.|title=San Diegans Hurl Chanclas at Trump During State of the Union Speech|url=https://www.nbcsandiego.com/news/local/San-Diegans-Hurl-Chanclas-at-Trump-During-State-of-the-Union-Speech-471939373.html|accessdate=3 February 2018|publisher=NBC San Diego|date=Jan 31, 2018}}</ref> *'''24 February:''' Bilal Haris hurled a shoe at Interior Minister [[Ahsan Iqbal]] during a Pakistan Muslim League-Nawaz (PML-N) workers convention in Narowal.<ref>{{cite web|title=Man hurls shoe at Ahsan Iqbal in Narowal|url=https://tribune.com.pk/story/1643760/1-man-hurls-shoe-ahsan-iqbal-narowal/|website=|publisher=Express News|accessdate=11 March 2018}}</ref> *'''27 February:''' [[Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf]] MPA [[Arbab Jahandad Khan]] hurled a shoe at MPA-elect [[Baldev Kumar]] in [[Khyber Pakhtunkhwa Assembly]].<ref>{{cite news|title=PTI MPA hurls shoe at Baldev Kumar in KP assembly|url=https://www.geo.tv/latest/183963-pti-mpa-hurls-shoe-at-baldev-kumar-in-kp-assembly|work=Geo News|date=February 27, 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=PTI MPA hurls shoe, lawmakers verbally abuse Baldev Kumar in K-P assembly|url=https://tribune.com.pk/story/1646311/1-shoe-k-p-lawmakers-hurl-shoes-verbally-abuse-ptis-baldev-kumar/|work=Express Tribune|date=February 27, 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=KP Assembly: Shoe attack on murder suspect MPA-elect|url=https://www.thenews.com.pk/print/286415-kp-assembly-shoe-attack-on-murder-suspect-mpa-elect|work=The News|date=February 28, 2018}}</ref> *'''11 March:''' Shoe was hurled at [[Nawaz Sharif]], former Prime Minister of Pakistan, when he was about to address a religious gathering at [[Jamia Naeemia Lahore]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Man Throws Shoes On Nawaz Sharif|url=https://www.samaa.tv/pakistan/2018/03/man-throws-shoe-nawaz-sharif/|website=www.samaa.tv|accessdate=11 March 2018}}</ref> *'''28 June:''' A slipper was hurled at Taipei City Mayor [[Ko Wen-je|Ko Wen-je(柯文哲)]] during an event at [[Taipei station|Taipei Main Station]]. The slipper was found with a note reading "臭鞋丟臭柯(Throw a stinky shoe at stinky Ko)". <ref>{{cite web|title=Ke Victim of Shoe Attack|url=https://www.icrt.com.tw/info_details.php?mlevel1=6&mlevel2=12&news_id=135103&reUrlAddr=L2luZGV4LnBocD8=/|website=https://www.icrt.com.tw|accessdate=3 July 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=|url=http://www.taipeitimes.com/News/taiwan/photo/2018/06/29/2008162011|website=http://www.taipeitimes.com|accessdate=3 July 2018}}</ref> *'''7 September:''' [[Cardi B]] threw a red stileto at [[Nicki Minaj]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Cardi B Threw a Shoe at Nicki Minaj at The Plaza|url=https://www.vanityfair.com/style/2018/09/cardi-b-nicki-minaj-fashion-week-fight|accessdate=9 September 2018}}</ref>
==See also== {{Commons category|Shoe throwing (protest)}}
*[[Egging]] *[[Glitter bombing]] *[[Inking (attack)]] *[[Pieing]] *[[Nikita Khrushchev shoe-banging incident]] *[[Villain hitting]]
== References == {{reflist|30em}}
